key_points: A 17-year-old boy was arrested for bringing a handgun to Southfield Regional Academic Campus in the Detroit area.
The arrest occurred a day after a deadly school shooting at Oxford High School several miles away, where four students were killed.
The school principal alerted a school resource officer after receiving a tip about a student possibly carrying a gun.
A purple Bersa Thunder .380-caliber gun with a magazine containing three bullets was found in the student's coat pocket.
Southfield Police Chief Elvin Barren stated the student had likely been carrying the weapon for several weeks.
The arrested teen claimed he found the weapon and had no rounds loaded in the gun's chamber.
Authorities do not believe the incident was a copycat of the Oxford High School shooting.
The student who reported the gun to the principal was commended by Chief Barren for his courageous action.
The gun will be examined to see if it has been used in crimes, and the prosecutor's office will decide on charging the teen.
Chief Barren warned of the false sense of power guns can give to individuals, leading to potential violence over disagreements.
